section.heading: Opinion Announcement of Justice William H. Rehnquist

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Mr. Justice Rehnquist has the opinion for the Court to announce in 74-884, United States against Powell.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: This case comes to us from the Eastern District of Washington where the respondent, one Josephine Powell, was convicted of mailing a firearm capable of being concealed on the person to with a sawed-off shotgun in violation of Title 18 United States Code, Section 1715.
The Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit reversed her conviction on the ground that this act of Congress was unconstitutionally vague.
In an opinion filed today with the clerk, we conclude that the statute of Congress was not unconstitutionally vague and we, therefore, reversed the judgment of the Court of Appeals.

section.heading: Opinion Announcement of Justice Potter Stewart

turn.speaker: potter_stewart
turn.label: Justice Potter Stewart
turn.text: I should just say that I have filed an opinion concurring in part and dissenting in part.

section.heading: Opinion Announcement of Justice William H. Rehnquist

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Thank you Mr. Justice Rehnquist, Mr. Justice Powell.
